single_cell_parser.cell.PySection¶

class single_cell_parser.cell.PySection(name=None, cell=None, label=None)[source]¶

Bases: nrn.Section

Subclass of nrn.Section providing additional geometric and mechanism information/ handling methods

__init__(name=None, cell=None, label=None)[source]¶

structure self.label = label

reference to parent section self.parent = None

connection point at parent section self.parentx = 1.0

bounding box around 3D coordinates self.bounds = ()

number of traced 3D coordinates self.nrOfPts = 0

list of traced 3D coordinates self.pts = []

list of relative position of 3D points along section self.relPts = []

list of diameters at traced 3D coordinates self.diamList = []

total area of all NEURON segments in this section self.area = 0.0

list of center points of segments used during simulation self.segPts = []

list of x values corresponding to center of each segment for looping akin to the hoc function for(x) (without 0 and 1) self.segx = []

list of diameters of all segments self.segDiams = []

list of neuron Vectors recording voltage in each compartment self.recVList = []

dict of range variables recorded self.recordVars = {}

hoc_internal_name

Hoc accepts this name wherever a section is syntactically valid.

Returns True if Section created from Python, False if created from HOC.

Section name (same as hoc secname())

orientation

Returns 0.0 or 1.0 depending on the x value closest to parent.

Return the nrn.Segment specified by the connect method.

allseg()¶

iterate over segments. Includes x=0 and x=1 zero-area nodes in the iteration.

arc3d()¶

Returns the arc position of the ith 3D point.

cell()¶

Return the object that owns the Section. Possibly None.

children()¶

Return list of child sections. Possibly an empty list

connect(parentSegment[, childEnd])¶
diam3d()¶

Returns the diam of the ith 3D point.

has_membrane()¶

Returns True if the section’s membrane has this density mechanism. This is not for point processes.

hname()¶

Section name (same as hoc secname())

hoc_internal_name()¶

Hoc accepts this name wherever a section is syntactically valid.

insert(densityMechanismName) e.g. soma.insert('hh')¶
is_pysec()¶

Returns True if Section created from Python, False if created from HOC.

n3d()¶

Returns the number of 3D points.

name()¶

Section name (same as hoc secname())

orientation()¶

Returns 0.0 or 1.0 depending on the x value closest to parent.

parentseg()¶

Return the nrn.Segment specified by the connect method. Possibly None.

psection()¶

Returns dict of info about Section contents.

pt3dadd()¶

Add the 3d location and diameter point (or points in the second form) at the end of the current pt3d list. Assume that successive additions increase the arc length monotonically.

pt3dchange()¶

Change the i’th 3-d point info. If only two args then the second arg is the diameter and the location is unchanged.

pt3dclear()¶

Clears all 3D points. Optionally takes a buffer size.

pt3dinsert()¶

Insert the point (so it becomes the i’th point) to section. If i is equal to sec.n3d(), the point is appended (equivalent to sec.pt3dadd())

pt3dremove()¶

Removes the ith 3D point.

pt3dstyle()¶

Returns True if using a logical connection point, else False. With first arg 0 sets to no logical connection point. With first arg 1 and x, y, z arguments, sets the logical connection point. Return value includes the result of any setting.

push() makes it the currently accessed section. Should end with a corresponding hoc.pop_section()¶
same()¶

sec1.same(sec2) returns True if sec1 and sec2 wrap the same NEURON Section

set_3d_geometry(pts, diams)[source]¶

invokes NEURON 3D geometry setup

set_segments(nrOfSegments)[source]¶

Set spatial discretization. should be used together with biophysical parameters to produce meaningful, yet efficient discretization. calls private methods to initialize recordings etc.

spine3d()¶

Returns True or False depending on whether a spine exists at the ith 3D point.

subtree()¶

Return list of sections in the subtree rooted at this section (including this section).

trueparentseg()¶

Return the nrn.Segment this section connects to which is closer to the root. Possibly None. (same as parentseg unless parentseg.x == parentseg.sec.orientation()

uninsert(densityMechanismName) e.g. soma.insert('hh')¶
wholetree()¶

Return list of all sections with a path to this section (including this section). The list has the important property that sections are in root to leaf order, depth-first traversal.

x3d()¶

Returns the x coordinate of the ith 3D point.

y3d()¶

Returns the y coordinate of the ith 3D point.

z3d()¶

Returns the z coordinate of the ith 3D point.

area¶

list of center points of segments used during simulation (only for visualization)

bounds¶

number of traced 3D coordinates

diamList¶

total area of all NEURON segments in this section

label¶

reference to parent section

nrOfPts¶

list of traced 3D coordinates

parent¶

connection point at parent section

parentx¶

bounding box around 3D coordinates

pts¶

list of relative position of 3D points along section

recVList¶

dict of range variables recorded

relPts¶

list of diameters at traced 3D coordinates

segDiams¶

list of neuron Vectors recording voltage in each compartment

segPts¶

list of x values corresponding to center of each segment for looping akin to the hoc function for(x) (without 0 and 1)

segx¶

list of diameters of all segments
